definition: orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Is it? Then I agreed, and magnolia good to be together each spring.
sentences.chinese: 是嗎？那我就和玉蘭花約定好每年春天都要相聚。

sentences.english: Magnolia leaving only bare branches where the bullet.
sentences.chinese: 玉蘭花也只留下光禿禿的枝幹在那裏苦撐。

sentences.english: The successive sunny days brings the blooming of Yulan Flower.
sentences.chinese: 連續晴天，杭州玉蘭花盛開。

sentences.english: The magnolias are in blossom and they attract many swallows.
sentences.chinese: 玉蘭花開吸引了許多燕子。

definition: tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
national grace, divine fragrance (idiom); an outstanding beauty
fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
national flower (emblem, e.g. peony 牡丹[mu3 dan1] in China)
thousands of purples and reds (idiom); a blaze of color/fig. a profusion of flourishing trades
